thread.title: Dr. Judy Niehaus
thread.title_full: willisorchards.com reviewed by Dr. Judy Niehaus

author: Dr. Judy Niehaus
title: Dr. Judy Niehaus
text: My brother loves the peppermint peach tree I gave him for his birthday. I saw one in Charleston SC and asked around until I got the name of the tree. Next step was to research the genetics. At first glance it looks like a graft, but no. The wild type has red flowers, and the peppermint is a white mutant, but the mutation is unstable. Whenever it back mutates, you get red. The next challenge was to find a nursery that sells peppermint peach. That's where you guys shine. Thanks for coming through. The tree is in the ground in Fayetteville, AR.
